channel.title: Linux Journal
channel.description:
Linux Journal, first published in 1994, is the original publication of the global Linux community, covering topics critical to intelligent implementation of the Linux operation system. With its award-winning Linux how-tos, tutorials, reviews, in-depth reporting, tips and tricks, and market analysis, Linux Journal has become well-known as the industry standard.

Pick up a copy of Linux Journal on major newsstands and in bookstores worldwide or subscribe by calling 1-888-66-LINUX or visiting http://www.linuxjournal.com/subscribe .
channel.itunes:summary: Linux Journal, first published in 1994, is the original publication of the global Linux community, covering topics critical to intelligent implementation of the Linux operation system. With its award-winning Linux how-tos, tutorials, reviews, in-depth rep
channel.itunes:author: Linux Journal Gadget Guy

item.title: Linux HOWTO: Video Editing Magic with ffmpeg
item.blip:puredescription: Non-linear video editing tools are great, but they're not always the best tool for the job. This is where a powerful tool like ffmpeg becomes useful. This tutorial covers the basics of transcoding video, as well as more advanced tricks like creating animations, screen captures, and slow motion effects. This video was created using only free and open source software tools: TightVNC, pyvnc2swf, ardour2, audacity, jackd, LAME, kolourpaint, cinelerra-cv, mjpegtools, and ffmpeg.
item.description: Non-linear video editing tools are great, but they're not always the best tool for the job. This is where a powerful tool like ffmpeg becomes useful. This tutorial covers the basics of transcoding video, as well as more advanced tricks like creating animations, screen captures, and slow motion effects. This video was created using only free and open source software tools: TightVNC, pyvnc2swf, ardour2, audacity, jackd, LAME, kolourpaint, cinelerra-cv, mjpegtools, and ffmpeg.
item.itunes:keywords: linux, journal, ffmpeg, transcode, encode, decode, video, movie, mpeg, avi, convert, special, effect, cinelerra, animation, slow, motion
item.media:keywords: linux, journal, ffmpeg, transcode, encode, decode, video, movie, mpeg, avi, convert, special, effect, cinelerra, animation, slow, motion
item.media:player: <embed src="http://blip.tv/play/1R7EogmH_18" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="500" height="375" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed>
item.media:title: Linux HOWTO: Video Editing Magic with ffmpeg

item.title: Linux HOWTO: Secure Your Data with PGP, Part 1
item.blip:puredescription: Linux Journal introduces: In today's time of rampant information crimes, including identity theft, security is more important to the average computer user than ever. This tutorial shows how you can use GnuPG to secure and verify data on your Linux box. This video was created using only free and open source software tools: TightVNC, pyvnc2swf, ardour2, audacity, jackd, LAME, kolourpaint, cinelerra-cv, mjpegtools, and ffmpeg.
item.description: Linux Journal introduces: In today's time of rampant information crimes, including identity theft, security is more important to the average computer user than ever. This tutorial shows how you can use GnuPG to secure and verify data on your Linux box. This video was created using only free and open source software tools: TightVNC, pyvnc2swf, ardour2, audacity, jackd, LAME, kolourpaint, cinelerra-cv, mjpegtools, and ffmpeg.

item.title: SCOTTEVEST Review by Linux Journal
item.blip:puredescription:
Scott-E-Vest makes innovative, versatile, technology-enabled clothing -- jackets, fleece layers, cargo vests, pants, shorts, shirts and more, all designed to help you store, manage, and carry your electronic gadgets and other gear essentials.

http://www.linuxjournal.com

item.title: X-Arcade Review by Linux Journal
item.blip:puredescription:
X-Arcade is an industrial quality arcade game controller that injects the ultimate arcade game experience into your PC, MAC or game console (we tested on Linux, of course).

With your X-Arcade Joystick, you can reverse time and play the classics like Ms. Pac-Man, Space Invaders, Robotron, Galaga, Donkey Kong and Street Fighter.

http://www.linuxjournal.com
item.description:
X-Arcade is an industrial quality arcade game controller that injects the ultimate arcade game experience into your PC, MAC or game console (we tested on Linux, of course).

With your X-Arcade Joystick, you can reverse time and play the classics like Ms. Pac-Man, Space Invaders, Robotron, Galaga, Donkey Kong and Street Fighter.

http://www.linuxjournal.com

item.media:keywords: game, gaming, electronics, diy, computer, video, gadget, arcade
